Title: Select Options that Apply to an Given Event
Description: Given an event, please select all options that apply to such event
title: Read a sentence fragment and select what you think people might do before this event.
task: select possible things that the person doing the event might need to do before
instruction:
Your task is to select all of the listed actions that you think make sense, using the following definitions:

    Before, PersonX needs answers the question: "does PersonX typically need to do anything before this event?"
    NOTE: Some events might not be caused willingly by PersonX, in which case you should select the "none" option.
examples:
Event Before, PersonX needs:
PersonX needs to (do)...
PersonX takes the test
PersonX goes to the movies
PersonX gives PersonY ___ as a gift
PersonX yells at the classroom
PersonX is very worried
PersonX draws the line
question: Before, PersonX needs —  What does PersonX need to do before this event? Select all that could apply.
note: Select "none" if the event happens to PersonX, i.e., PersonX doesn't cause the event willingly.
event: personx does not increase personx's knowledge
Answer.qxAtt: to be lazy|to not study

Title: Select Options that Apply to an Given Event
Description: Given an event, please select all options that apply to such event
title: Read an event description and select which words would describe the person doing the event.
task: select possible descriptions/attributes of the person doing it
instruction:
Your task is to select all of the listed attributes that you think make sense, using the following guidelines:

  • For each event, think about how you would describe PersonX, based on their participation in the event.
  • For each description, think about what attributes PersonX might typically have. Adjectives will usually be appropriate.
  • Avoid descriptions of PersonX's feelings.
examples:
Event possible descriptions/attributes for PersonX:
PersonX is...
PersonX takes the test
PersonX goes to the movies
PersonX gives PersonY ___ as a gift
PersonX yells at the classroom
PersonX is very worried
PersonX draws the line
question: PersonX attributes: What adjectives best describe PersonX in this event? Select all that apply.
note: Avoid feelings or words that appear in the event.
none: (there are no good words to describe PersonX)
event: personx does not move past persony
Answer.qxAtt: stubborn|reserved|steadfast|patient

Title: Select Options that Apply to an Given Event
Description: Given an event, please select all options that apply to such event
title: Read a sentence fragment and select what you think people might do after this event.
task: select possible things that the event participants might want to do after
instruction:
Your task is to select all of the listed actions that you think make sense, using the following definitions:

    After, others want answers the question "what will others likely want to do next, after this event?"
    Other people could be either explictly mentioned (e.g. "PersonY") or implied to be included in the event (e.g. a "classroom" usually contains students).
    If the event could sometimes have other people and sometimes not have them, then answer the questions including those other people.
    NOTE: Some events won't involve any other participants, in which case you should select the "none" option.
examples:
Event After, others want:
Others might want to...
PersonX takes the test
PersonX goes to the movies
PersonX gives PersonY ___ as a gift
PersonX yells at the classroom
PersonX is very worried
PersonX draws the line
question: After, others want —  What do other people affected by the event likely want to do next after this event? Select all that apply.
note:
Other people means PersonY, PersonZ, and people included but not mentioned in the event.
Select "none" if this event only affects PersonX or affects no one.
event: personx does not look angry
xAtt9: to tell personx to calm down

Title: Select Options that Apply to an Given Event
Description: Given an event, please select all options that apply to such event
title: Read an event and select which effects it has on its participants.
task: select possible (mostly involuntary) effects that it has on its participants
instruction:
Your task is to select all of the listed effects that you think make sense, using the following guidelines:

  • Focus on specific physical or mental effects.
  • Events which happen to people are events which they do not choose to do.
  • Events which happen to people should not include feelings.
examples:
Event possible effects on PersonX:
PersonX...
PersonX takes the test
PersonX goes to the movies
PersonX gives PersonY ___ as a gift
PersonX yells at the classroom
PersonX is very worried
PersonX draws the line
question: Effect on PersonX —  What are some possible effects of this event on PersonX? Select all that apply.
event: personx does not have fun playing
Answer.qxAtt: goes home|loses interest

Title: Select Options that Apply to an Given Event
Description: Given an event, please select all options that apply to such event
title: Read event description and select applicable possibilities for the reactions associated with the event.
task: select possible reactions to this event
instruction:
Your task is to select all of the listed reactions that you think make sense, using the following definitions:

 

    Others's reaction answers the question "how do other people typically feel after the event?"
    Other people could be either explictly mentioned (e.g. "PersonY") or implied to be included in the event (e.g. a "classroom" usually contains students).
    If the event could sometimes have other people and sometimes not have them, then answer the questions including those other people.
    NOTE: Some events won't involve any other participants, in which case you should select the "none" reaction.
examples:
Event possible Others's reactions

PersonX goes to the movies
PersonX gives PersonY ___ as a gift
PersonX yells at the classroom
PersonX is very worried
PersonX draws the line
question: Others' reactions —  How do other people affected by the event feel afterwards? Select all that apply.
note:
Other people means PersonY, PersonZ, people included but not mentioned in the event.
Select "none" if this event only affects PersonX or affects no one.
event: personx does not earn more money
Answer.qxAtt: disappointed|upset|unhappy

Title: Select Options that Apply to an Given Event
Description: Given an event, please select all options that apply to such event
title: Read an event and select which effects it has on its participants.
task: select possible (mostly involuntary) effects that it has on its participants
instruction:
Your task is to select all of the listed effects that you think make sense, using the following guidelines:

  • Focus on specific physical or mental effects.
  • Events which happen to people are events which they do not choose to do.
  • Events which happen to people should not include feelings.
  • Other people could be either explictly mentioned (e.g. "PersonY") or implied to be included in the event (e.g. a "classroom" usually contains students).
    If the event could sometimes have other people and sometimes not have them, then answer the questions including those other people.
    NOTE: Some events won't involve any other participants, in which case you should select "none".
examples:
Event possible effects on others:
Others...
PersonX takes the test
PersonX goes to the movies
PersonX gives PersonY ___ as a gift
PersonX yells at the classroom
PersonX is very worried
PersonX draws the line
question: Effect on others —  What are some possible effects of this event on others? Select all that apply.
note:
Other people means PersonY, PersonZ, people included but not mentioned in the event.
Select "none" if this event only affects PersonX or affects no one.
event: personx does not meet personx's standards

Title: Select Options that Apply to an Given Event
Description: Given an event, please select all options that apply to such event
title: Read an event description and select which words would describe the person doing the event.
task: select possible descriptions/attributes of the person doing it
instruction:
Your task is to select all of the listed attributes that you think make sense, using the following guidelines:

  • For each event, think about how you would describe PersonX, based on their participation in the event.
  • For each description, think about what attributes PersonX might typically have. Adjectives will usually be appropriate.
  • Avoid descriptions of PersonX's feelings.
examples:
Event possible descriptions/attributes for PersonX:
PersonX is...
PersonX takes the test
PersonX goes to the movies
PersonX gives PersonY ___ as a gift
PersonX yells at the classroom
PersonX is very worried
PersonX draws the line
question: PersonX attributes: What adjectives best describe PersonX in this event? Select all that apply.
note: Avoid feelings or words that appear in the event.
none: (there are no good words to describe PersonX)
event: personx does not forget persony's wallet
Answer.qxAtt: thoughtful

task: select possible intents to this event
instruction:
Your task is to select all of the listed intents that you think make sense, using the following definitions:

 

    Intent answers the question: "why does PersonX willingly cause the event?"
    NOTE: Some events might not be caused willingly by PersonX, in which case you should select the "none" intent.
examples:
Event possible PersonX's intents
PersonX takes the test
PersonX goes to the movies
PersonX gives PersonY ___ as a gift
PersonX yells at the classroom
PersonX is very worried
PersonX draws the line
question: PersonX's intent —  Why does PersonX cause this event? Select all that could apply.
note: Select "none" if PersonX doesn't cause the event willingly.
none: (PersonX does not cause the event willingly)
event: personx does not do yard work
Answer.qxAtt: to be lazy|to do something else|to do other things|to relax

Title: Select Options that Apply to an Given Event
Description: Given an event, please select all options that apply to such event
title: Read a sentence fragment and select what you think people might do after this event.
task: select possible things that the event participants might want to do after
instruction:
Your task is to select all of the listed actions that you think make sense, using the following definitions:

    After, others want answers the question "what will others likely want to do next, after this event?"
    Other people could be either explictly mentioned (e.g. "PersonY") or implied to be included in the event (e.g. a "classroom" usually contains students).
    If the event could sometimes have other people and sometimes not have them, then answer the questions including those other people.
    NOTE: Some events won't involve any other participants, in which case you should select the "none" option.
examples:
Event After, others want:
Others might want to...
PersonX takes the test
PersonX goes to the movies
PersonX gives PersonY ___ as a gift
PersonX yells at the classroom
PersonX is very worried
PersonX draws the line
question: After, others want —  What do other people affected by the event likely want to do next after this event? Select all that apply.
note:
Other people means PersonY, PersonZ, and people included but not mentioned in the event.
Select "none" if this event only affects PersonX or affects no one.
event: personx does not fit personx's needs
xAtt9: to find someone else to help

Title: Select Options that Apply to an Given Event
Description: Given an event, please select all options that apply to such event
title: Read event description and select applicable possibilities for the reactions associated with the event.
task: select possible reactions to this event
instruction:
Your task is to select all of the listed reactions that you think make sense, using the following definitions:

 

    PersonX's reaction answers the question "how does PersonX typically feel after the event?"
examples:
Event possible PersonX's reactions
PersonX takes the test
PersonX goes to the movies
PersonX gives PersonY ___ as a gift
PersonX yells at the classroom
PersonX is very worried
PersonX draws the line
question: PersonX's reactions —  How does PersonX typically feel after the event? Select all that apply.
event: personx does not take a bow
Answer.qxAtt: like a coward

Title: Select Options that Apply to an Given Event
Description: Given an event, please select all options that apply to such event
title: Read an event and select which effects it has on its participants.
task: select possible (mostly involuntary) effects that it has on its participants
instruction:
Your task is to select all of the listed effects that you think make sense, using the following guidelines:

  • Focus on specific physical or mental effects.
  • Events which happen to people are events which they do not choose to do.
  • Events which happen to people should not include feelings.
examples:
Event possible effects on PersonX:
PersonX...
PersonX takes the test
PersonX goes to the movies
PersonX gives PersonY ___ as a gift
PersonX yells at the classroom
PersonX is very worried
PersonX draws the line
question: Effect on PersonX —  What are some possible effects of this event on PersonX? Select all that apply.
event: personx does not visit the city
xAtt9: stresses about not seeing his family
Answer.qxAtt: stays home|loses job|loses friends|thinks about staying home|thinks about going|gets bored|stresses about not visiting|gets called|stresses about not seeing his family

Title: Select Options that Apply to an Given Event
Description: Given an event, please select all options that apply to such event
title: Read an event description and select which words would describe the person doing the event.
task: select possible descriptions/attributes of the person doing it
instruction:
Your task is to select all of the listed attributes that you think make sense, using the following guidelines:

  • For each event, think about how you would describe PersonX, based on their participation in the event.
  • For each description, think about what attributes PersonX might typically have. Adjectives will usually be appropriate.
  • Avoid descriptions of PersonX's feelings.
examples:
Event possible descriptions/attributes for PersonX:
PersonX is...
PersonX takes the test
PersonX goes to the movies
PersonX gives PersonY ___ as a gift
PersonX yells at the classroom
PersonX is very worried
PersonX draws the line
question: PersonX attributes: What adjectives best describe PersonX in this event? Select all that apply.
note: Avoid feelings or words that appear in the event.
none: (there are no good words to describe PersonX)
event: personx does not open the doors
Answer.qxAtt: stubborn|careful|lazy|scared|shy|careless|unaware|timid|tired|cold

task: select possible (mostly involuntary) effects that it has on its participants
instruction:
Your task is to select all of the listed effects that you think make sense, using the following guidelines:

  • Focus on specific physical or mental effects.
  • Events which happen to people are events which they do not choose to do.
  • Events which happen to people should not include feelings.
examples:
Event possible effects on PersonX:
PersonX...
PersonX takes the test
PersonX goes to the movies
PersonX gives PersonY ___ as a gift
PersonX yells at the classroom
PersonX is very worried
PersonX draws the line
question: Effect on PersonX —  What are some possible effects of this event on PersonX? Select all that apply.
event: personx does not catch persony's attention
Answer.qxAtt: is ignored|gets ignored|personx is ignored

Title: Select Options that Apply to an Given Event
Description: Given an event, please select all options that apply to such event
title: Read an event and select which effects it has on its participants.
task: select possible (mostly involuntary) effects that it has on its participants
instruction:
Your task is to select all of the listed effects that you think make sense, using the following guidelines:

  • Focus on specific physical or mental effects.
  • Events which happen to people are events which they do not choose to do.
  • Events which happen to people should not include feelings.
  • Other people could be either explictly mentioned (e.g. "PersonY") or implied to be included in the event (e.g. a "classroom" usually contains students).
    If the event could sometimes have other people and sometimes not have them, then answer the questions including those other people.
    NOTE: Some events won't involve any other participants, in which case you should select "none".
examples:
Event possible effects on others:
Others...
PersonX takes the test
PersonX goes to the movies
PersonX gives PersonY ___ as a gift
PersonX yells at the classroom
PersonX is very worried
PersonX draws the line
question: Effect on others —  What are some possible effects of this event on others? Select all that apply.
note:
Other people means PersonY, PersonZ, people included but not mentioned in the event.
Select "none" if this event only affects PersonX or affects no one.
event: personx does not increase personx's knowledge
Answer.qxAtt: learns something new|does not learn|learns nothing|they learn less|loses respect for personx

Title: Select Options that Apply to an Given Event
Description: Given an event, please select all options that apply to such event
title: Read event description and select applicable possibilities for the intent associated with the event.
task: select possible intents to this event
instruction:
Your task is to select all of the listed intents that you think make sense, using the following definitions:

 

    Intent answers the question: "why does PersonX willingly cause the event?"
    NOTE: Some events might not be caused willingly by PersonX, in which case you should select the "none" intent.
examples:
Event possible PersonX's intents
PersonX takes the test
PersonX goes to the movies
PersonX gives PersonY ___ as a gift
PersonX yells at the classroom
PersonX is very worried
PersonX draws the line
question: PersonX's intent —  Why does PersonX cause this event? Select all that could apply.
note: Select "none" if PersonX doesn't cause the event willingly.
none: (PersonX does not cause the event willingly)
event: personx did not smooth persony's hair
Answer.qxAtt: to do something else|to make persony look bad|to let persony do it

Title: Select Options that Apply to an Given Event
Description: Given an event, please select all options that apply to such event
title: Read event description and select applicable possibilities for the reactions associated with the event.

instruction:

    Others's reaction answers the question "how do other people typically feel after the event?"
    Other people could be either explictly mentioned (e.g. "PersonY") or implied to be included in the event (e.g. a "classroom" usually contains students).
    If the event could sometimes have other people and sometimes not have them, then answer the questions including those other people.

PersonX is very worried
PersonX draws the line
question: Others' reactions —  How do other people affected by the event feel afterwards? Select all that apply.

Title: Select Options that Apply to an Given Event
Description: Given an event, please select all options that apply to such event
title: Read an event description and select which words would describe the person doing the event.
task: select possible descriptions/attributes of the person doing it
instruction:
Your task is to select all of the listed attributes that you think make sense, using the following guidelines:

  • For each event, think about how you would describe PersonX, based on their participation in the event.
  • For each description, think about what attributes PersonX might typically have. Adjectives will usually be appropriate.
  • Avoid descriptions of PersonX's feelings.
examples:
Event possible descriptions/attributes for PersonX:
PersonX is...
PersonX takes the test
PersonX goes to the movies
PersonX gives PersonY ___ as a gift
PersonX yells at the classroom
PersonX is very worried
PersonX draws the line
question: PersonX attributes: What adjectives best describe PersonX in this event? Select all that apply.
note: Avoid feelings or words that appear in the event.
none: (there are no good words to describe PersonX)
event: personx does not meet the band
Answer.qxAtt: incompetent|unprepared|unskilled|unlucky|sad|uninterested

Your task is to select all of the listed reactions that you think make sense, using the following definitions:

 

    Others's reaction answers the question "how do other people typically feel after the event?"
    Other people could be either explictly mentioned (e.g. "PersonY") or implied to be included in the event (e.g. a "classroom" usually contains students).
    If the event could sometimes have other people and sometimes not have them, then answer the questions including those other people.
    NOTE: Some events won't involve any other participants, in which case you should select the "none" reaction.
examples:
Event possible Others's reactions
PersonX takes the test
PersonX goes to the movies
PersonX gives PersonY ___ as a gift
PersonX yells at the classroom
PersonX is very worried
PersonX draws the line
question: Others' reactions —  How do other people affected by the event feel afterwards? Select all that apply.
note:
Other people means PersonY, PersonZ, people included but not mentioned in the event.
Select "none" if this event only affects PersonX or affects no one.
event: personx does not receive a phone call
Answer.qxAtt: sad|worried|annoyed|unwanted|disappointed|rejected|angry|confused|upset
